page.title: 05RELIGION IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Church of England: The Foundation Stone for the Church of All Saint's was laid in 1861 and the Church was consecrated by the Bishop of Salisbury on 4th November, 1862. A Family Service is held once a month, and Communion is celebrated on all other Sundays. In any month when there is a fifth Sunday, there is Evensong. The Priest-in-Charge holds Services in Chitterne, Orcheston and Tilshead, and lives in the Vicarage in Tilshead. This is only a small Living. The right is still retained by Deed to have four Churchwardens, two for each of the Parishes of Chitterne. There was a Church for both parishes until the 19th century, when All Saint's was built to replace the two. Baptists: They hold an informal Service once a month, while people of other faiths travel to nearby towns.
